TopicTitle: what was the ascent trajectory of the mercury missions(the suborbitals one)

Articles.Content:
What was the ascent trajectory of the first mercury missions:were they going straight up or were they doing a gravity turn?

Thank for reading this (very)short thread!

The original name of mercury project is project astronaut. But later it was changed to Project Mercury. The suborbital mission was to launch the Redstone rocket into space and see the gravity level. It just fell towards Earth and landed in an ocean.
The two manned missions reached apogees of 116.5 and 118.3 miles. Both went down range about 300 miles.

ok,but were they doing a gravity turn during the launch?

Or were they going straight up until they had no more fuel left?
Read the post above, they travelled more downrange than they travelled vertically, so they didn't go "straight up".
